thread.title: January transfer window: This manager has ended up as the biggest loser among all of the Premier League clubs
thread.title_full: January transfer window: This manager has ended up as the biggest loser among all of the Premier League clubs

author: John Cross
title: January transfer window: This manager has ended up as the biggest loser among all of the Premier League clubs
text:
Bournemouth boss Eddie Howe was desperate to strengthen his squad in January (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   Could   
EDDIE HOWE was one of the busiest managers in the January window last season. 
Bournemouth boss Howe spent £10m on Benik Afobe and £7m on Lewis Grabban and they have both had mixed fortunes. 
Having also spent £15m on Jordon Ibe last summer, Bournemouth fielded their most expensive ever line-up - totalling £44m - against Millwall in the FA Cup last month, it was almost a reserve line-up, and they crashed out. 
It is fair to say Howe is building a reputation as one of the best young English managers and Bournemouth have once again enjoyed an excellent first half to the Premier League season. 
But Howe was desperate to strengthen his squad in January - and has ended up as perhaps the biggest loser among all of the Premier League clubs. Howe was busy in the last January window (Photo: Alex Livesey/Getty) 
They signed England under-19s keeper Aaron Ramsdale from Sheffield United and he is regarded as an outstanding prospect and one for the future. 
But there was nothing else as all of their targets went awry and they missed out on a string of players in the final week. Read More 10 things we learned from the Premier League this week as Chelsea's rivals fail to close the gap 
Often in football there is a belief that even a new face can give a squad and a dressing room a huge lift no matter who it is. It is just good to get a new body in. 
Bournemouth went for lofty targets which would have definitely improved the squad as they bid more than £10m for Chelsea’s No2 keeper Asmir Begovic . Bournemouth were after JT on loan but failed to secure a deal (Photo: AFP) 
The deal would have happened if Chelsea had been able to buy a new back-up keeper but their own targets did not come off and they refused to let Begovic go. 
Bournemouth were also interested in making a permanent deal for Chelsea’s Nathan Ake who they had on loan this season but offered £18m late in the window. 
They were juggling balls in the air, having been linked with John Terry, above, and also enquired about Branislav Ivanovic before he joined Zenit St Petersburg . Reece Oxford ended up joining Reading on loan (Photo: Arfa Griffiths) 
Bournemouth were interested in West Ham’s Reece Oxford , above, who was available on loan and there was a sniff of interest in trying to sign a couple of right backs. 
But they missed out on them all and by the time they went back for Oxford he was going to Reading on loan and they waited too long on Begovic because there was no time to get another keeper. Read More Andrew Surman admits Bournemouth have to be “very careful” after dip in form leads to relegation fears 
Bournemouth have had a dip in form, having not won in 2017 and they also had a worrying dip in form at the back end of last season. 
Howe’s men surely have enough of a cushion above the relegation zone to be safe but Bournemouth’s attempts to push on during the run-in have taken a major blow because of their lack of success in January. Like us on Facebook
